{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3527171,"name":"","username":"Matheus","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/ecd19e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T17:15:37.115Z","cooked":"

hello, we are programming our robot to do an automatic alignment using limelight 3g, we did a 3d alignment that was very accurate, but it has a shorter range to activate the automatic alignment mode and when it is very close to the april tag it does not read it because the robot is very close, so we did an alignment using drivepose, which has a greater range and goes directly to where we want regardless of where we are, however we have more difficulty developing and having precision, which path should I follow?

You could mount the camera differently so it sees the tags longer, Are you updating the robot pose estimate with vision?

Which vision system are you using? How many cameras and where are they located on the robot? Are the camera locations precise?
Have you run Sysid?
Search Chief Delphi for ‘tune pathplanner’ and you’ll find a lot of information about improving accuracy and repeatability.
